org.teamfarce.mirch.entities

Class AbstractPerson

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion
      • com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite
        • org.teamfarce.mirch.entities.MapEntity
          • org.teamfarce.mirch.entities.AbstractPerson
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    tileLocation
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Player, Suspect

    public abstract class AbstractPerson
extends MapEntity
    Created by brookehatton on 01/02/2017.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AbstractPerson.PersonPositionComparator
      This class is to sort a list of AbstractPerson in highest Y coordinate to lowest Y coordinate It is used to render NPCs and the Player in the correct order to avoid it appearing as though someone is standing on top of someone else
      static class  AbstractPerson.PersonState
      The state of the person explains what they are currently doing.

        public static final int SPRITE_HEIGHT
        The height of the texture region for each person
        See Also:

      • SPRITE_WIDTH

        public static final int SPRITE_WIDTH
        The width of the texture region for each person
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove
        This is whether the NPC can move or not. It is mainly used to not let them move during converstation

      • dialogue

        public Dialogue dialogue
        This is the persons dialogue, it contains all their responses to any questions given to them.

      • currentRegion

        protected com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion currentRegion
        This stores the current region of the above texture that is to be drawn to the map

      • spriteSheet

        protected com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture spriteSheet
        This stores the sprite sheet of the Player/NPC

      • toMoveTo

        protected java.util.List<Vector2Int> toMoveTo
        This stores a list of tiles that have been found by the A* Search Algorithm. The NPC/Player needs to keep following these tiles until empty.

        MIRCH game
        Reference to the game

        Direction direction

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractPerson

        public AbstractPerson(MIRCH game,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String description,
                      java.lang.String spriteSheetFile,
                      Dialogue dialogue)
        Initialise the entity.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the entity.
        description - The description of the entity.
        spriteSheetFile - The spriteSheetFile of the image to display for the entity.

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public abstract void move(Direction dir)
        This controls the movement of a person

      • getState

        public AbstractPerson.PersonState getState()

      • update

        public void update(float delta)
        This is called to update the players position. Called from the game loop, it interpolates the movement so that the person moves smoothly from tile to tile.

      • initialiseMove

        public void initialiseMove(Direction dir)
        Sets up the move, initialising the start position and destination as well as the state of the person. This allows the movement to be smooth and fluid.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction that the person is moving in.

      • finishMove

        public void finishMove()
        Finalises the move by resetting the animation timer and setting the state back to standing. Called when the player is no longer moving.

      • updateTextureRegion

        public void updateTextureRegion()
        Updates the texture region based upon how far though the animation time it is.

      • aStarPath

        public java.util.List<Vector2Int> aStarPath(Vector2Int destination)
        This is the a* Path finding algorithm. It finds the best possible path from the Persons current position to the defined destination position.
        Parameters:
        destination - - The goal location
        Returns:
        List the list of tiles to move to, from their current location to the goal destination.

      • getLowestFScore

        public Vector2Int getLowestFScore(java.util.List<Vector2Int> openSet,
                                  java.util.HashMap<Vector2Int,java.lang.Integer> fScore)
        This method is used to get the cheapest next node from the open list
        Parameters:
        openSet - - The open list of locations
        fScore - - The estimated scores of each node to the goal
        Returns:
        Vector2Int the next best node from openSet

      • distFromNeighbour

        public int distFromNeighbour(Vector2Int current,
                             Vector2Int neighbour)
        This method gets the distance from one node to another.
        Parameters:
        current - - One position
        neighbour - - The second position
        Returns:
        - Integer, the distance between the 2 positions

      • reconstructPath

        public java.util.List<Vector2Int> reconstructPath(java.util.HashMap<Vector2Int,Vector2Int> cameFrom,
                                                  Vector2Int current)
        This method is called once the A* Pathfinding algorithm has been completed. It reconstructs the path from the goal to the start point
        Parameters:
        cameFrom - - A map of a node(key) , and the value being the node that we came from to get to the key node.
        current - - The final node. The goal destination
        Returns:
        List this is the list of tiles that are needed to be walked on to reach the goal

      • getNeighbours

        public java.util.List<Vector2Int> getNeighbours(Vector2Int current)

      • heuristic

        public int heuristic(Vector2Int start,
                     Vector2Int end)

        public void setDirection(Direction dir)
